title: Threeleaper
text:
A threeleaper or trébuchet is a <a href="fairy%20chess%20piece">fairy chess piece</a> that jumps three squares orthogonally (the directions a chess <a href="Rook%20%28chess%29">rook</a> can move), leaping over any intermediate piece. Below, it is given the symbol H from <a href="Fairy%20chess%20piece%23Ralph%20Betza%27s%20%26quot%3Bfunny%20notation%26quot%3B">Betza notation</a>.
Value.
The threeleaper by itself is not much more powerful than a <a href="pawn%20%28chess%29">pawn</a>, but as an additional power to other pieces it is worth about half a <a href="knight%20%28chess%29">knight</a>. Its value as a piece by itself is severely compromised by its being only being able to reach a ninth of the squares on any size of chessboard; combining it with other pieces usually masks this weakness to some extent.
